column4: hi, i've a problem, my burnet image of ubuntu is not able to install the latest version. there are errors
unable to find medium for live cd
then i'd do as was suggested and check the md5sum to make sure the download was not corrupt
this could be due to either a faulty drive like gogeta said, the CD burned incorrectly or the ISO you downloaded wasn't correct
gogeta not sure here what it might stems from
is your computer capable of booting from USB and do you have a spare USB stick lying around?
the reason i ask is i always install using a USB, then you dont waste CD's, its faster and if your drive is broken or not working right you avoided that problem
is it easy to make a usb install nowdays?
Easy peasy, are you on Windows now?
